document_data.name: Dharin Brislen
document_data.mainbody:
'''Dharin Brislen''' was the husband to [[Leepak Brislen]] and father to [[Blossom Brislen|Blossom]] and [[Bunny Brislen]], all inhabitants of the [[Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|I hate sending Leepak and the girls off without me, but if that smuggler can get them to Waterdeep and away from the Absolute...|Dharin Brislen}}
document_data.Description: Dharin was a [[human]] with a tan skin tone, hazel eyes, and bright chestnut hair gathered in a bun. He wore a simple workman garb.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, as the [[Cult of the Absolute]] menaced the city of Baldur's Gate, Dharin attempted to ship his wife and daughters away from the Gate. He attempted to negotiate a passage to [[Waterdeep]] with Captain [[Sleam]], a smuggler with her own boat and crew. Sleam asked for too much money claiming it was a life and death situation for her crew too. Dharin could not afford to pay for four seats so he resorted for staying behind. It was unknown of the family escaped the Gate before the battle of the [[Upper City]] commenced.
